name: Learn
description: Manually record an insight, correction, preference, or rule that the agent should remember for future tasks.
prompt:
The user wants to teach you something. Record this learning so it persists across sessions.

## LEARNING
{{what}}

## CATEGORY
{{category}}

## INSTRUCTIONS

1. Acknowledge what the user wants you to learn.
2. Store the learning as a memory using the appropriate method based on category:
   - If category is "preference": Also note it as a user preference for future reference.
   - If category is "correction": Frame it as a mistake to avoid repeating.
   - If category is "rule": Frame it as a constraint to always follow.
   - If category is "insight": Frame it as a useful pattern or knowledge.
3. Write a one-line summary of the learning to the workspace file `.cowork/MEMORY.md` (create the file if it doesn't exist, append to the appropriate section if it does). Use the format:
   - `- [{{category}}] {{what}} (recorded on current date)`
4. Confirm to the user what was recorded and where.

## RULES
- Do NOT ask clarifying questions. Record exactly what the user said.
- Keep the stored text concise (under 200 characters).
- If the learning contradicts a previous memory, note the update.
- Never store sensitive data (API keys, passwords, tokens).

parameters.name: what
parameters.description: The insight, correction, preference, or rule to remember

routing.useWhen: Use when the user explicitly wants to teach the agent something, record a preference, save a correction, or store a rule for future tasks.
routing.dontUseWhen: Don't use for general conversation, one-time instructions that don't need to be remembered, or when the user is just chatting.
routing.outputs: Persisted learning in memory system and .cowork/MEMORY.md file.
routing.successCriteria: Learning is stored in memory and written to .cowork/MEMORY.md with confirmation to the user.
